sentences.sCn: 你们接受美国运通信用卡吗？

sentences.sContent: If you take my advice , you’ll see a doctor.
sentences.sCn: 如果你听我的意见，就去看医生。

sentences.sContent: Our helpline take s 3.5 million calls (= telephone calls ) a year.
sentences.sCn: 我们的求助热线每年接听350万个电话。

sentences.sContent: Some doctors are unwilling to take new patients without a referral.
sentences.sCn: 有些医生不愿意接收没有转诊单的新病人。

sentences.sContent: Liz found his criticisms hard to take .
sentences.sCn: 利兹觉得他的批评很难接受。

sentences.sContent: I just can’t take any more (= can’t deal with a bad situation any longer ) .
Staff have agreed to take a 2% pay cut.

phrases.pCn: 承担；呈现；具有；流行；接纳；雇用；穿上
v. 取出；去掉；出发；抵充
接受；理解；拘留；欺骗；让…进入；改短

words.tran: 可爱的；迷人的；会传染的
接受者；接受打赌的人；捕获者

trans.tranCn: 拿走； 接受， 接纳
trans.tranOther: to accept or choose something that is offered, suggested, or given to you
